thread.title: Defending champ Allen shoots for first win of 2015 - San Antonio Express-News
thread.title_full: Defending champ Allen shoots for first win of 2015 - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Whisler
title: Defending champ Allen shoots for first win of 2015 - San Antonio Express-News
text:
Photo: MARVIN PFEIFFER, STAFF / Marvin Pfeiffer/ Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Michael Allen from San Mateo, Ca. checks his lie on 18th hole during the final round of the AT&T Championship, Champions Tour golf tournament at TPC San Antonio, AT&T Canyons Course on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2014. Allen won the tournament at 15 under. MARVIN PFEIFFER/ mpfeiffer@express-news.net Michael Allen from San Mateo, Ca. checks his lie on 18th hole during the final round of the AT&T Championship, Champions Tour golf tournament at TPC San Antonio, AT&T Canyons Course on Sunday, Oct. 25, 2014. ... more Photo: MARVIN PFEIFFER, STAFF / Marvin Pfeiffer/ Express-News Defending champ Allen shoots for first win of 2015 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Defending champion Michael Allen enters play this week seeking his first win on the Champions Tour this year.
The 56-year-old San Mateo, California, native has seven top 10s in 19 starts but only three since May.
He won twice a year ago, including the 2014 San Antonio Championship when he birdied three of the final four holes to overtake Marco Dawson and prevail by two strokes.
Allen will try to become the third player to defend a title on the Champions Tour this year.
Couples eyes first win: Fan favorite Fred Couples returns for his fourth Champions Tour event in San Antonio.
Couples, who won the tournament in 2011 in its first year at AT&T Canyons Course, is looking for his first win on tour this year after winning at least once in five consecutive years.
He comes into the San Antonio Championship having finished among the top six in his past four tournaments.
Stretch run: A number of players are battling for spots in the season-ending Charles Schwab Cup Championship, Nov. 2-8, at Desert Mountain Club in Scottsdale, Arizona. The top 30 players in the Schwab Cup standings qualify for the tournament. Among those on the bubble are players ranking 31-35: Rocco Mediate , Rod Spittle, Stephen Ames , Mark Calcavecchia and Fred Funk .
Cook-ing up success: Two-time winner John Cook , playing in his ninth Champions Tour event in San Antonio, is the tournamentâ€™s all-time leading money winner with $855,095 in earnings. Cook won back-to-back in 2007 and 2008. He has three top 5s and two other top 25 finishes.
Interesting matchups: A number of intriguing groupings are scheduled Friday, headed by Jeff Maggert , Colin Montgomery and Kenny Perry off the first tee at 10:50 a.m.
Allen, Calcavecchia and Couples tee off on No. 1 at 10:30, while Billy Andrade , Dawson and Bernhard Langer are set for 11:20.
